problem.p: In the diagram, the blocks are connected by an ideal string. The axle of the pulley and the inclined plane are frictionless. Masses \(M_{1}\) and \(M_{2}\) as well as angle θ are given. The system is held at rest and then released.
Part 1. Which of the following statements are true?

li.p: Block \(M_{1}\) must be moving down the incline
Block \(M_{2}\) must be moving downward
There is just one specific ratio of \(M_{1}\) and \(M_{2}\) that may keep the blocks at rest
There is a range of ratios of \(M_{1}\) and \(M_{2}\) that may keep the blocks at rest
Blocks \(M_{1}\) and \(M_{2}\) will have the same magnitude of acceleration
For block \(M_{1}\), the change in its kinetic energy is equal and opposite to the change in its potential energy
For block \(M_{2}\), the change in its kinetic energy is equal and opposite to the change in its potential energy
For the system of blocks \(M_{1}\) and \(M_{2}\), the change in its kinetic energy is equal and opposite to the change in its potential energy
The total momentum of blocks \(M_{1}\) and \(M_{2}\) remains constant

problem.p: Part 2. Now suppose there is friction between \(M_{1}\) and the inclined plane. The system is held at rest and then released. Which of the following statements are true?

li.p: Block \(M_{1}\) must be moving down the incline
Block \(M_{2}\) must be moving downward
There is just one specific ratio of \(M_{1}\) and \(M_{2}\) that may keep the blocks at rest
There is a range of ratios of \(M_{1}\) and \(M_{2}\) that may keep the blocks at rest
Blocks \(M_{1}\) and \(M_{2}\) will have the same magnitude of acceleration
For block \(M_{1}\), the change in its kinetic energy is equal and opposite to the change in its potential energy
For block \(M_{2}\), the change in its kinetic energy is equal and opposite to the change in its potential energy
For the system of blocks \(M_{1}\) and \(M_{2}\), the change in its kinetic energy is equal and opposite to the change in its potential energy
The total momentum of blocks \(M_{1}\) and \(M_{2}\) remains constant

problem.p: Part 3. During the motion of the blocks, their speeds remain equal at all times as long as:

li.p: There is no friction in the system
The connecting string has negligible mass
The connecting string does not stretch
The mechanical energy is conserved
Block \(M_{1}\) is moving upward
Block \(M_{1}\) is moving downward

problem.p: Part 4. During the motion of the blocks, the magnitude of the force of tension acting on each block is the same at all times, as long as:

li.p: There is no friction in the system
The connecting string and the pulley have negligible masses
The connecting string does not stretch
The mechanical energy is conserved
Block \(M_{1}\) is moving upward
Block \(M_{1}\) is moving downward
Newton's 3rd law remains valid
